options.text: I would want to be hugged.
I would want someone to tell me comforting words.
I would want someone to give me their undivided attention.
I would want a care package.
I would want advice.
People go out of their way to help me with a task.
Somebody gives me a hug or holds my hand.
People tell me how they appreciate me.
People buy me gifts.
People want to spend time with me.

questions.question: When I want to celebrate I want to …

options.text: Hang out with my friends.
Give out candy to others.
Help others feel happy too.
Be congratulated by my loved ones.
Give everyone high fives.

questions.question: If I am nervous before a test ...

options.text: I would want someone to hold my hand.
I would want someone to encourage me.
I would want someone to help me study.
I would want someone to give me candy to eat during the test.
I would want someone to spend tutorial with me.

questions.question: I feel most encouraged by teachers when …

options.text: They reassure me about myself.
They spend lunch helping me learn the material.
They provide me with a lot of resources to help me study.
They give me small gifts.
They pat my back or give me high fives.

questions.question: If I went on a road trip with friends, the best part of it is …

options.text: Spending undivided time with my friends.
Planning out the trip.
Leaning against my friends.
My friends talking about how fun the trip is.
Buying souvenirs with each other.

questions.question: When I move out, I will miss my parents …

options.text: Telling me how proud they are of me.
Patting my head.
Making me breakfast.
Spending time with me.
Buying me things I want.

questions.question: I create bonds easily with my team (sports, clubs, etc.) when …

options.text: We make a handshake.
We play games together.
We exchange compliments.
When someone brings food for our group.
When someone gives me advice about my performance.

questions.question: I express my love for my parents by …

options.text: Hugging them.
Expressing gratitude. Words of Affirmation
Doing chores.
Making them a card.
Having dinner together.

questions.question: What is a must-have when hanging out with friends?

options.text: Having deep conversations
A gift exchange
Talking about qualities we believe stand out in each other
Helping each other out with a problem or task
Giving each other hugs or high fives
